member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute
member.summary: Specifies an access level for a class or property.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.GetAccessAttribute(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the access attribute for the specified type.
member.returns: The attribute for the type -or- null if no attribute is found.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.#ctor(Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Specify both read and write access to be the same level.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.#ctor(Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Specifies different read and write access levels.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.ReadLevel
member.summary: Gets the read access level for this attribute.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.WriteLevel
member.summary: Gets the write access level for this attribute.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.HasAccess(Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Returns true if the user's access level exceeds the required level.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.HasReadAccess(Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified user level is allowed read access.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttribute.HasWriteAccess(Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified user level is allowed write access.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper
member.summary: Specifies an access level for a class or property.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper.GetAccess(System.Type,System.String,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Return the allowed access mode for the given type, property and user level. The access level may be specified in the application configuration file (such as "Ace.exe.config"). However, if a more restrictive access attribute is specified in the source code for that class or property, then the more restrictive value is used.
member.example:
In the first line of the following example, write access is limited to the "Ace.CartesianObject" class to users with access level "OemCustomizer" or above. In the second line, read access is limited to the "Parent" property to users with access level engineer or above. The property will be invisible to others. These lines should be placed in the "AccessSection" section of the application configuration file:
<AccessElement name="Ace.CartesianObject" writeAccess="OemCustomizer"/> <AccessElement name="Ace.CartesianObject_Parent" readAccess="Engineer"/>
member.param: Property name to check (or null for class itself).
member.returns: Allowed access mode.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper.VerifyWriteAccess(System.Type,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the specified object's class may NOT be edited from the GUI.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessAttributeHelper.VerifyReadAccess(System.Type,Ace.Core.Server.Access.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the specified object's class may NOT be viewed from the GUI.

member.remarks: This attribute will typically not be used in a user application.

member.summary: Creates an access control attribute using the specified access controller class, with an arbitrary argument.
member.param: Type used to control access to the specified property. This must be a subclass of IAccessControl.
Arbitrary argument passed to the access control function.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate that will be invoked to post an event from a SafeEvent.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent
member.summary: A "safe" event class that performs two critical functions. First, it drops event handlers that throw exceptions. This is very important to do when events are reported using .NET remoting, since errors occur if the remote client is disconnected, but we don't want to stop other clients from receiving messages. Second, it will optionally report events in a background thread to avoid delaying critical threads. It spear ates the events into 2 categorizes: events local to the current application doman and events remote to the domain. Events that are local to the application domain are always thrown in-line. Remote events are always thrown in a background thread.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.EventDetails
member.summary: Tracking class holding information about a remote event that is being processed

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.#cctor
member.summary: Starts the background invocation thread.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.#ctor(System.String,Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEventHandler)
member.summary: Create a "safe" event for the specified handler.
member.param: The delegate/handler to be called when the event is raised.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.ToString
member.summary: Returns the descriptive string passed into the constructor.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.Add(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Adds a delegate to the list.

member.summary: Returns the count of delegates for this event.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.RemoteDelegateCount
member.summary: Returns the count of remote delegates for this event.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.Remove(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Removes a delegate from the list.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.Raise(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread, handling all exceptions by removing the invoker from the execution list.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: The identifier associated with the event.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.Raise(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread.
member.param: if set to true the exception is automatically handled. If set to false, any exceptions encountered are re-thrown so they can be handled by the caller.
if set to true the events local to the current application domain will be thrown.
if set to true the events not local to the current application domain will be thrown.
The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: The identifier associated with the event.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.RaiseBackground(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raise an event with the specified arguments in the current thread.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEvent.RaiseEvents(System.Boolean,System.Object,System.EventArgs,System.Boolean,System.Delegate[])
member.summary: Raise the events with the specified arguments in the current thread.
member.param: if set to true the exception is automatically handled. If set to false, any exceptions encountered are re-thrown so they can be handled by the caller.
The instance containing the event data.
if set to true the event handlers are local. If false, the events are remote

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Event.SafeEventPump
member.summary: Manage a queue of events for sending to the SafeEvent handler.
member.remarks: This should be used for high frequency events between the server and client process. The SafeEvent object can only queue up a limited number of events. If it gets saturated, the system can lock up. This class uses a background thread to meter a collection of events to the SafeEvent object, eliminating the stack up of events.

member.summary: Gets the number of events in the pump.

member.summary: Saves the workspace to the specified path. Updates the default workspace path to be the specified path.

The progress handler getting notification of the progress.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.IAceServer.SaveLocalWorkspace
member.summary: Saves the workspace file in the case client and server are on the same PC.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.IAceServer.SaveLocalWorkspace(System.String,System.EventHandler{Ace.Core.Server.Event.ProgressEventArgs})
member.summary: Saves the workspace files in the case client and server are on the same PC. Instead of using .NET remoting to transfer the workspace file content from server to client, this method directly transfers the path to a temporary file containing the data. This method allows a better efficiency to transfer the data from server to client but it must NOT be called if server and client are on different PCs.
member.returns: The path to a temporary file in which client side workspace is saved.

member.summary: Saves the AceObject to a ZIP stream.
member.param: Stream to which to write the collection.
true to write the contents in XML format.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.ICartesianObject
member.summary: An object in the work cell with a Cartesian location. Objects that extend this class may build a "scene graph" of connections to define their location. For example, a robot may be mounted to a table, an end-effector to the robot, and a part attached to the end-effector. So the location of the object may be determined by appending the location of its parent (if any) with its offset. Cartesian objects may be rendered in 3D simulations.
member.remarks: A user application will typically not use this interface.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.ICartesianObject.ParentLocation
member.summary: World location of the parent of this object, or the identity transform if this object has no parent.

member.summary: Trajectory complete.

member.summary: Robot is accelerating as it starts a new motion.

member.summary: Robot is ramping down acceleration as it starts a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.summary: Constant velocity section of motion is active.

member.summary: Robot is ramping up acceleration as it blends into a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.summary: Robot is accelerating into a new motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Motion.TrajectoryState.BlendRampDown
member.summary: Robot is ramping down acceleration as it blends into a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.summary: Robot is decelerating as it completes a motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Motion.TrajectoryState.DecelRampDown
member.summary: Robot is ramping down deceleration as it completes a motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.summary: Trajectory complete, but robot is not yet in tolerance.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.RequestValue(Ace.Core.Server.IAceObject,System.String)
member.summary: Request the user to provide a value. Allows retry or abort.
member.example:
This is usually called in a loop like:
while (myValue == null) RequestValue(this, "My Value");
member.param: The object whose value is undefined.
A description associated with the message.
member.returns: User response code. If abort was selected, and exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Program.Task.PostMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Post a message to the current task. If not executing as a task, does nothing.

A description associated with the message.
member.returns: User response code. If abort was selected, and exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.Debug.IDebugHelper
member.summary: Helper class used to monitor and debug a process In the CSharp Script Editor class, which is the main user of this object, we deal with 0-based line numbers. The MDBG engine is dealing with 1-based line numbers. To handle that, all public methods and properties must expose 0-based line numbers.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Scripting.Executioner.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the execution object with the specified server object
member.returns: Any exceptions encountered in the initialization process
member.remarks: This method will not allow an unhandled exception. If running in a separate AppDomain, it would bring down the app domain and possibly the entire process. This method will return any exceptions encountered and let the client report the errors within it's own context.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Euler
member.summary: Defines the order of Euler angles that are supported by the Transform3D class.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Euler.Xyz
member.summary: X-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about X, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Server.Euler.Zyz
member.summary: Z-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about Z, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D
member.summary: A "homogeneous transformation", which describes the offset and orientation of one XYZ coordinate system from another as a single entity.
member.remarks:
An affine, non-scaling transform may be written as
[ xAxis.X yAxis.X zAxis.X offset.X ] [ xAxis.Y yAxis.Y zAxis.Y offset.Y ] [ xAxis.Z yAxis.Z zAxis.Z offset.Z ] [ 0 0 0 1 ]
where xAxis, yAxis, and zAxis are unit vectors specifying the new XYZ axes in the coordinate system of the old XYZ axes, and offset specifies the offset of the new origin from the old origin, along the old axes. A Transform3D is immutable--once defined, it cannot be changed. This makes it behave much as a value type.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D.GetLabels(Ace.Core.Server.Euler)
member.summary: Returns a collection of labels associated with the array values returned by ToArray(Euler).

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor
member.summary: This class is a wrapper around an event descriptor. It will be used in the PropertyGrid to display an event as a property. It has been inspired by the code of the wrapper class used by the EventBindingService implementation: http://www.koders.com/csharp/fid7D88D393A9B726FFC28AE70B694B3CFD6401C8B3.aspx?s=control It does return the event descriptor to the property grid to automatically display the description of the event.

member.name: F:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.eventDescriptor
member.summary: The inner event descriptor.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.EventDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the event descriptor.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.GetEventHandlerName(System.ComponentModel.IComponent,System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor)
member.summary: Gets the name of the event handler.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.CanResetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns whether resetting an object changes its value.
member.param: The component to test for reset capability.
member.returns: true if resetting the component changes its value; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.ComponentType
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the type of the component this property is bound to.
member.returns: A that represents the type of component this property is bound to. When the or methods are invoked, the object specified might be an instance of this type.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.IsReadOnly
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether this property is read-only.
member.returns: true if the property is read-only; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.PropertyType
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the type of the property. We will expose events with the type of this class, and convert them to/from string using a type converter.
member.returns: A that represents the type of the property.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.ResetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, resets the value for this property of the component to the default value.
member.param: The component with the property value that is to be reset to the default value.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.GetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the current value of the property on a component.
member.param: The component with the property for which to retrieve the value.
member.returns: The value of a property for a given component.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.SetValue(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the value of the component to a different value.
member.param: The component with the property value that is to be set.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.EventAsPropertyDescriptor.ShouldSerializeValue(System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, determines a value indicating whether the value of this property needs to be persisted.
member.param: The component with the property to be examined for persistence.
member.returns: true if the property should be persisted; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Util.PickListAttribute
member.summary: A class attribute that flags a class so that it may be added to 'pick lists' for creating new objects.
member.remarks:
The path to be displayed in pick lists must be defined in a resource file specified in AssemblyInfo.cs by the line:
[assembly: ResourceFile("PickList", "Ace.Core.Client.PickList")]
where "Ace.Core.Client.PickList" is replaced by the actual resource file name. In that file, the key "Classname" should contain a line containing the path of the program in the pick list, where each folder is delimited by a vertical-bar ('|') character. For example, corresponding to the key "MyClass" might be the value "Motion|My Class", where "My Class" will appear in the "Motion" folder in the pick list.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.RemotingUtil.CreateServerChannels(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create the communication channels required by a server. Currently there are 2 connection channels created: 'ipc' and 'tcp'. For each channel type, 2 channels are needed. One is tied to a specific port so a client can access the server. The other is used for callbacks to the client on a secondary channel.
member.param: Port at which object is to be registered.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.RemotingUtil.CreateClientChannels(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create client side communications channels. Currently there are 2 connection channels created: 'ipc' and 'tcp'. For each channel type, 2 channels are needed. One is tied to a specific port so a server can access event objects on the server on a callbback channel. The other is used to connect the client to the server.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.ContainsUnicodeCharacter(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a given string contains a unicode character
member.returns: True if the input string contains at least one unicode character

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.IsSpecialCharacterCulture
member.summary:
Determines whether the current culture requires special characters. This is used to determine whether, for instance, fonts with a limited character set should be overridden.
Currently, only the supported Chinese cultures fit this determination.
member.returns: True if the current culture requires special characters

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.BuildRtfString(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Build an RTF string by escaping unicode characters. ASCII valued characters are not modified.
member.param: if set to true a default formatting will be applied to the display text.
Input string that needs to be converted for RTF
member.returns: RTF string containing escaped unicode characters

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.StringToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to bytes. If a unicode character is encountered, 0x0200 (unicode start byte + null byte) is inserted in the byte array before writing the character. When the next ASCII character is encountered, 0x0300 (unicode end byte + null byte) is again inserted in the byte array before writing the ASCII character.
member.returns: array of bytes

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.BytesToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts bytes to a string. If a byte array with unicode characters is received, we extract the characters using ASCII encoding until 0x0200 (unicode start byte + null byte) is encountered. Then, extract the subsequent characters using Unicode encoding until 0x0300 (unicode end byte + null byte) is encountered.
member.returns: string containing unicode characters

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Util.TextUtil.ConvertASCIIByteToUnicodeBytes(System.Byte)
member.summary: Converts an ASCII 1-byte character to its equivalent unicode 2-byte representation
member.returns: 2-byte unicode representation of the ASCII character
